title: FBI: Kwame Brathwaite

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Kwame Brathwaite
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records mentioning or pertaining to the American photographer and photo-journalist Kwame Brathwaite. Brathwaite was born on January 1st 1938 and died on April 1st of 2023. His death was widely reported in the mainstream media, with coverage of his death by CNN and other media outlets. Brathwaite's brother was a man named Elombe Brath who was active in the 1960s civil rights movement. Brathwaite's photography promoted the "black as beautiful" artistic movement and of particular interest would be any monitoring by the bureau of Brathwaite's work or travels. 

This is a request for any records mentioning, or pertaining to, Kwame Brathwaite, with a special emphasis on any FBI records mentioning Brathwaite and his connections to the Patrice Lumumba Coalition or the Marcus Garvey Coalition or the broader Civil Rights movement. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Kwame Brathwaite. 

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related Brathwaite. 

According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Kwame Brathwaite. Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working on resolving this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Records re: April 5 fires set to excavators at Atlanta Public Safety Training Center construction site & Emails/texts mentioning “Brent Scarbrough”, April 4, 2023-present (DeKalb County Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any police reports, incident reports, video footage, and/or Computer Assisted Dispatch records related to the reported burning of three excavators owned by Brent Scarbrough Company on the night of April 5, 2023. Please not that it is possible this incident may have also been recorded as taking place in the early hours of April 6, 2023 and may or may not be associated with either of the addresses: Constitution Rd & West Side Pl, ATLANTA, 30316 and KEY RD SE / MORELAND AVE SE, KEY RD SE & MORELAND AVE SE, ATL, GA 30316.

-Any emails or text messages sent or received by any employee of your agency between April 4, 2023 and the date on which this request is processed which includes the keyword phrase “Brent Scarbrough.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Schiano

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-114 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Wyoming Department of Corrections ************************************************************************ Your first Wyoming Department of Corrections record request (request number #23-114) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. In compliance with the Wyoming Public Records Act, this letter is your 7 day response to your request for access to public records which was received by Wyoming Department of Corrections (WDOC) on the date listed in this response.  The WDOC is compiling and reviewing the records in response to your request.  The WDOC must extend the response time of your request from seven (7) days to thirty (30) days due to the high volume of public record request we receive.  Once prepared, fee payment is due if needed.  You will be notified if any fees apply and any work that is completed that requires no charge will be provided.    Please do not hesitate to contact the WDOC through this system if we can be of further assistance. Request #23-114. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Wyoming Department of Corrections.

Technical support: See our help page

title: Digital Device Filtering Concerns and Remediation

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Digital Device Filtering Concerns and Remediation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records from January 2020 to February 2023:

All records related to the decision to provide iPads and other digital devices to students in the district, including any communications or correspondence related to this decision.
All records related to the implementation of web filtering or lack thereof on the iPads and other digital devices provided to students in the district, including any communications or correspondence related to this decision.
All records related to any complaints from parents regarding the lack of web filtering on the iPads and other digital devices provided to students in the district, including any communications or correspondence related to these complaints.
All records related to the response from the district to the complaints from parents regarding the lack of web filtering on the iPads and other digital devices provided to students in the district, including any communications or correspondence related to this response.
All records related to any steps taken by the district to address the lack of web filtering on the iPads and other digital devices provided to students in the district, including any communications or correspondence related to these steps.
To help identify responsive records, please search for any records that mention or relate to the following terms:

iPads
digital devices
web filtering
complaints
parental concerns

Please include records of any type, including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, reports, meeting minutes, presentations, and any other records of communication or correspondence related to the topics listed above.

If no records are responsive to this request, please provide a certification of that fact pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3), and inform me of the district's obligations under LGS-01 to retain records until any appeal has been resolved.

If any records are withheld, please provide an explanation of the legal basis for the withholding.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation of the reasons for the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Tennessee General Assembly

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee General Assembly
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Tennessee Open Records Act, §10-7-503 et seq., I am requesting records related to the following statutes: “HB0009” AKA House Bill 9, “SB0003” AKA Senate Bill 3, “HB0001” AKA House Bill 1, “SB0001” AKA Senate Bill 1, “SB0005” AKA Senate Bill 5, “HB1378” AKA House Bill 1378, “HB0030” AKA House Bill 30, “SB0841” AKA Senate Bill 841.

1. All records of internal memoranda, email correspondence, and other written communication sent and/or received by the members of the Tennessee General Assembly and the individuals named in the attachment to this request titled “TN_General Assembly_Attachment” from the year 2021 to the date this request is processed. Please limit your search to the following non-case-sensitive key-strings: “HB0009” “SB0003” “Senate Bill 3” “HB0001” “SB0001” “SB0005” “HB1378” “HB0030” “SB0841” “woke” “transgender” “drag” “hormone” “hormone replacement therapy” “adult cabaret entertainment” “purported identity” “biological sex” “asserted identity” “adult cabaret entertainment.” Responsive records should include email metadata (sender address, receiver address, time-stamps, etc.), the email subject, the body of the email, and any/all documents attached to each respective email sent/received.
2. All digital calendars and schedules related to the statutes listed above.
3. All digital calendar invitations sent and/or received by the members of the Tennessee General Assembly and the individuals named in the attachment between 2021 to the date this request is processed.
4. All slides and presentations concerning the statutes listed above, including materials prepared by outside parties and shared with the assembly
5. All Q&As and Fact Sheets concerning the statutes listed above, including drafts and materials prepared by outside parties and shared with the assembly

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available. Please produce these records in the electronic format (such as .pdfs).

The release of the information is for non-commercial purposes. I am a journalist with Insider, a news organization, whose mission is journalism in the public interest. This request is for news gathering purposes. I will use the records to inform the public through our reporting. I therefore request a waiver of all fees and charges pursuant to the Tennessee Open Records Act. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

As I am making this request as a journalist and the information sought is in the public interest, I request that you expedite the production of responsive records. If previously released records are responsive to my request, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Tennessee Open Records Act. If you claim such an exemption to my request under the Tennessee Open Records Act, please cite in writing the specific statutory exemption. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Hannah Beckler.

title: Rasheem Carter

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Police reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Police reports filed to the Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any incident reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any investigation file referring to the case of Rasheem Carter
- Any video footage the Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department has in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. Carter's family shared video footage of a trail camera showing Rasheem on a wooded trail near Taylorsville indicating that there is video footage. 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Smith County Sheriff's Department head Charlie Crumpton that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 

HuffPost reported that Smith County Sheriff's Department is overseeing the criminal investigation into Rasheem's death. Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn told a local newspaper in December that Rasheem Carter filed a police report when he visited the station but declined to press any charges against whomever was threatening him. Police found Rasheem's body on November 2, 2022. https://www.natchezdemocrat.com/2022/12/07/family-seeking-answers-in-fayette-mans-death/

Local media reported that the Mississippi Bureau of Investigation stepped in to assist in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. https://www.wlbt.com/2023/03/22/mbi-asking-publics-help-rasheem-carter-death-investigation/ 

I'm a senior reporter for the Guardian, and the family has been outspoken about this case. The case is a matter of public interest given that the case has been unresolved at the moment, without a suspect in custody, and the case is under investigation. That said, I would request a rolling release of materials if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

He has been quoted in news reports answering questions on the department's behalf about the Rasheem Carter case. 

Thanks, 

Edwin Rios, The Guardian

title: Delta Pilot - Initial

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Delta Pilot - Initial
communications.communication:
Greetings FBI FOIA official

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I request any reports, statements, or other records generated in connection with the widely covered incident involving the mistaken detention/interrogation of a Delta Air Lines pilot involving your employees at a hotel in the Boston area. You can limit your search to the period between the detention of the pilot and 23:59 Eastern time on Friday, April 7th 2023. Please include records generated by the FBI, other federal agencies, other law enforcement entities, or the hotel. I am not seeking press/media inquiries or responses, messages from members of the public regarding the incident, etc.

I am filing this request as a private individual and have no commercial or profit purpose in making this request. I am willing to pay all applicable fees up to $100. I request a statement if fees will exceed that amount. I would prefer the request be fulfilled electronically by portal upload.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Joseph Durso

title: Documents on the Designers of Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) - Joan Daemen, Vincent Rijmen, and Relevant Programs.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents on the Designers of Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) - Joan Daemen, Vincent Rijmen, and Relevant Programs.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any and all records and documents pertaining to the designers of the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), specifically Joan Daemen and Vincent Rijmen. I request that these documents be made available to me in their entirety.

As you are aware, the AES is a widely used encryption algorithm that has been adopted as a standard by the United States government and is used extensively in the private sector. Given the importance of encryption in today's society, it is imperative that the public has a better understanding of the origins and design of the AES.

In support of this request, I would like to cite case law that has upheld the public's right to access government records under FOIA. Specifically, in United States Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989), the Supreme Court held that FOIA should be interpreted liberally to promote transparency and accountability in government. Additionally, in ACLU v. U.S. Department of Defense, 628 F.3d 612 (D.C. Cir. 2011), the D.C. Circuit held that the public has a right to access information about the government's use of encryption technologies.

To ensure that all relevant documents are provided, I request access to any records that mention or relate to Joan Daemen, Vincent Rijmen, or the AES. This would include, but is not limited to, any communications, memoranda, reports, or other documents related to the design or development of the AES. I also request access to any metadata or other information related to the NSA's XKEYSCORE program or any other program that may be relevant to this request.

Furthermore, I would like to draw your attention to the attached article entitled "The extended Rijndael-like block ciphers". This article provides important context and background information on the AES and its designers. I request that this article be considered as a part of my FOIA request, and that any relevant documents referenced in the article be included in my request.

Additionally, I request that a keystring search be conducted for any records related to Joan Daemen, Vincent Rijmen, or the AES. Furthermore, I would like to request any records related to the NSA's Enterprise Secure Logon User Repository (ESLUR) that may pertain to the AES or its designers.

Finally, I request that the NSA not withhold or redact any responsive documents, even if they have been deleted. Any redactions or withholdings must be justified under FOIA's exemptions, and I reserve the right to challenge such redactions or withholdings in court.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request to the National Security Agency for Records Related to Monitoring of Internet Memes

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to the National Security Agency for Records Related to Monitoring of Internet Memes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents held by the National Security Agency (NSA) related to the monitoring or analysis of internet memes.

As internet memes become an increasingly popular form of communication on social media and other online platforms, there have been concerns about governments and political campaigns using them to influence public opinion. It is important to understand how the NSA may be monitoring or analyzing these memes in order to protect privacy and civil liberties.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the NSA's monitoring or analysis of internet memes, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this monitoring or analysis. Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the NSA's use of internet memes for any purpose, including propaganda or disinformation campaigns.

I am also requesting any records related to the ELSUR program, XKeyscore program, metadata collection, or any other related programs that may be used for monitoring internet traffic and communications.

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the NSA can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the FOIA. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

Furthermore, I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the NSA to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the FOIA.

In support of this request, I would like to reference case law that affirms the public's right to access government records related to surveillance and monitoring. One key case is United States Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989), which held that the FOIA reflects a "general philosophy of full agency disclosure" and that any exemptions to the FOIA must be narrowly construed. Another important case is Electronic Privacy Information Center v. National Security Agency, 678 F.3d 926 (D.C. Cir. 2012), which held that the NSA must release information related to the agency's monitoring of internet traffic and communications.

If any responsive records or documents are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide me with a justification for each exemption relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request to Polk County Sheriff for Documents and Training on Dealing with Individuals with Autism

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request to Polk County Sheriff for Documents and Training on Dealing with Individuals with Autism
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents held by the Polk County Sheriff's Office related to their training and procedures for dealing with individuals with autism.

I am aware of the Polk County Sheriff's Office's Autism Decal program, which provides a way for individuals with autism and their caregivers to inform law enforcement officers of their condition. I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the development and implementation of this program, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to the program.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the Polk County Sheriff's Office's training and procedures for dealing with individuals with autism, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this training or procedures. I am also requesting any communications between the Polk County Sheriff's Office and other law enforcement agencies or government entities related to the training or procedures for dealing with individuals with autism.

Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to any incidents involving individuals with autism and the Polk County Sheriff's Office, including any use of force or arrests.

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the Polk County Sheriff's Office can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the Florida Public Records Law. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

Furthermore, I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the Polk County Sheriff's Office to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the Florida Public Records Law.

In support of this request, I would like to reference relevant case law that affirms the public's right to access government records. One key case is Times Publishing Co. v. City of St. Petersburg, 558 So. 2d 487 (Fla. 2d DCA 1990), which held that the Florida Public Records Law reflects a "strong public policy in favor of access to public records." Another important case is News-Press Publishing Co. v. Carlson, 410 So. 2d 546 (Fla. 2d DCA 1982), which held that the Florida Public Records Law applies to all "writings made or received by an agency in connection with official business."

If any responsive records or documents are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide me with a justification for each exemption relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

I am writing to follow up on my previous email dated 04/06/2023 in which I requested access to records related to the Polk County Sheriff's Office's training and procedures for dealing with individuals with autism.

title: Documents Related to Books Banned for Critical Race Theory or LGBTQ+ Themes by the  Miami-Dade  Department of Education

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Documents Related to Books Banned for Critical Race Theory or LGBTQ+ Themes by the  Miami-Dade  Department of Education
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents held by the Miami-Dade Department of Education related to books that have been banned or removed from schools due to their connection to Critical Race Theory (CRT) or their depiction of LGBTQ+ characters or themes.

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the Miami-Dade Department of Education can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the Florida Sunshine Law. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

Furthermore, I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the Miami-Dade Department of Education to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the Florida Sunshine Law.

In support of this request, I would like to reference case law that affirms the public's right to access government records under the Florida Sunshine Law. One key case is Times Publishing Co. v. Williams, 222 So. 2d 470 (Fla. 2d DCA 1969), which held that the public has a right to access government records and that any exemptions to the FOIA must be narrowly construed. Another important case is Board of County Commissioners of Palm Beach County v. Dain, 719 So. 2d 1063 (Fla. 4th DCA 1998), which held that a government agency must provide a specific justification for withholding or redacting information under an exemption to the FOIA.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the decision-making process behind the banning or removal of books from schools due to their connection to CRT or their depiction of LGBTQ+ characters or themes. This may include but is not limited to any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this decision-making process.

Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to any complaints or challenges made against books due to their connection to CRT or their depiction of LGBTQ+ characters or themes. This may include but is not limited to any correspondence or communication between the Miami-Dade Department of Education and individuals or groups involved in such challenges or complaints.

Furthermore, I am requesting a list of all books that have been banned or removed from schools in Florida due to their connection to CRT or their depiction of LGBTQ+ characters or themes. Please provide the title, author, and reason for the banning or removal of each book.

If any responsive records or documents are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide me with a justification for each exemption relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Texas Department Of Public Safety Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Department Of Public Safety Documents Related to Surveillance of Black Lives Matter and Related Groups
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to documents held by the Texas Department of Public Safety related to their surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter and other related groups. In order to ensure a comprehensive search for responsive records, I am also requesting an interagency search for any records that may be held by other law enforcement agencies or government entities.

I want to emphasize that I do not consent to the withholding, deletion, or redaction of any responsive records or documents, except in cases where the Texas Department of Public Safety can provide a specific justification for why the records are exempt from disclosure under the Texas Public Information Act. Please provide me with any non-exempt records or documents in their entirety, including any segregable portions that may be released.

Furthermore, I hereby provide notice that any attempt to withhold, redact, or delete responsive records or documents without providing a specific justification for why they are exempt from disclosure will be met with a complaint and legal action to compel the Texas Department of Public Safety to provide access to the requested records in accordance with the Texas Public Information Act.

In support of this request, I would like to reference local case law and state case law that affirm the public's right to access government records under the Texas Public Information Act. Specifically, local case law includes the Dallas Morning News v. City of Dallas, 281 S.W.3d 708 (Tex. App. – Dallas 2009, no pet.), which held that a government entity cannot withhold requested information unless it can demonstrate that the information falls within a specific exception under the Texas Public Information Act. State case law includes the Texas Department of Public Safety v. Cox Texas Newspapers, LP, 304 S.W.3d 191 (Tex. App. – Austin 2009, pet. denied), which affirmed the public's right to access government records and held that the Texas Department of Public Safety must release requested information unless it falls within a specific exception under the Texas Public Information Act.

Specifically, I am seeking any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the Texas Department of Public Safety's surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter, including any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to this surveillance or investigation. I am also requesting any communications between the Texas Department of Public Safety and other law enforcement agencies or government entities related to the surveillance or investigation of Black Lives Matter.

Additionally, I am interested in any records, reports, memoranda, emails, or other documents related to the Texas Department of Public Safety's surveillance or investigation of any groups or individuals associated with Black Lives Matter or involved in activism related to racial justice, police reform, or other related issues. This may include but is not limited to groups such as the Movement for Black Lives, Campaign Zero, and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP).

Furthermore, I would like to request a key string search for any records or documents related to Black Lives Matter or any other related groups, as well as any communications or activities related to these groups. Additionally, please provide any records or documents related to any specialty units within the Texas Department of Public Safety that may be involved in surveillance or investigation activities related to Black Lives Matter or other related groups.

If any responsive records or documents are exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide me with a justification for each exemption relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any records or files held by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) related to Jason William Mizell, who is also known as Jam Master Jay. Mizell was a founding member of the hip-hop group Run-DMC and a pioneer in the music industry. He was tragically killed on October 30, 2002, at his recording studio in Queens, New York. I am referencing an article from Rolling Stone magazine, published on March 4, 2021, titled "Jam Master Jay Alleged Killer Goes to Trial," which provides some background on the investigation into his death and the subsequent trial of his alleged killer.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I request that all records be released to me, including any documents, memos, emails, or other materials that reference or relate to Jason William Mizell or his death. Additionally, I request that a key string search be conducted to ensure that all relevant records are provided to me. Specifically, I would like to request that the following key strings be used in the search:

Jam Master Jay
Jason Mizell
Run-DMC
Murder
Homicide
Investigation
Suspect
Arrest
Trial
Evidence
Witness
Statement
Interview
Autopsy
Forensic
Ballistics
Gang
Drug
Criminal
Violence
New York City
I also request any records that may be responsive to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) program.

I would like to remind you that the FOIA reflects a strong presumption in favor of disclosure, and that any exemptions to the Act must be narrowly construed. The Supreme Court has held that the FOIA promotes transparency and accountability in government, and that any exemptions to the Act must be based on specific and narrowly defined grounds. See United States Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989); John Doe Agency v. John Doe Corp., 493 U.S. 146 (1989); and Nat'l Archives & Records Admin. v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004), among other cases.

Therefore, I would like to give notice that I do not consent to any withholding, redaction, or deletion of records that may be responsive to my request, except in cases where the documents are clearly exempt from disclosure under the FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Request for NYPD Documents and Memos Regarding Press Dealings and Press Credentials

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for NYPD Documents and Memos Regarding Press Dealings and Press Credentials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any documents or memos related to the New York City Police Department's (NYPD) dealings with the press or obtaining press credentials, for the period of January 1, 2022 to the present.

I am specifically interested in any documents or memos that provide guidance or procedures to NYPD officers on how to handle interactions with members of the press, how to verify the authenticity of press credentials, or how to distinguish between legitimate press activity and unlawful activity.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Buffalo News, Inc. v. Buffalo Enterprise Development Corp., 84 N.Y.2d 488, 493 (1994), the court held that "[e]xemptions from disclosure must be narrowly construed, with the burden resting on the agency to demonstrate that the requested material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Communications and Documents Related to Trump Indictment and NYPD Monitoring of Protests

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Communications and Documents Related to Trump Indictment and NYPD Monitoring of Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to the following records for the time period of January 1, 2023 to the present:

All communications (including emails, letters, memos, and text messages) between the New York City Police Department (NYPD) and the Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) related to the preparation and readiness of an indictment against Donald Trump, his associates, or his businesses.

All documents (including intelligence reports, after action reports, and surveillance logs) related to NYPD's monitoring of protests or demonstrations that take place in New York City.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Westchester Rockland Newspapers, Inc. v. Kimball, 50 N.Y.2d 575, 581 (1980), the court held that "[t]he burden rests upon the agency to demonstrate that the material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption by articulating a particularized and specific justification for denying access." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Dr. Brian Hyatt - patient complaints

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Dr. Brian Hyatt - patient complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records pertaining to Dr. Brian Thomas Hyatt, M.D., license number E-4598, from September 2005 to the date this request is processed, including but not limited to all allegations and sustained patient complaints submitted to the Arkansas State Medical Board against this medical professional. 

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter for Business Insider, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released (rather than prioritizing whichever records are named first). Also, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available. Also, I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Beckler

title: Request for Complaints against Donald J Trump

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Complaints against Donald J Trump
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any and all complaints filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regarding Donald J Trump during his time as a public figure and/or businessperson, on a rolling basis.

Specifically, I am seeking any complaints, filings, or other communications received by the SEC that reference Donald J Trump, his businesses, or his associates. This may include complaints related to securities fraud, insider trading, or any other area over which the SEC has jurisdiction.

I would like to request information on any companies owned or controlled by Donald J Trump, including but not limited to the Trump Organization, Trump Foundation, and Trump International Hotels. Please include any and all relevant communications, documents, or other materials related to complaints filed against these entities or their representatives.

To support my request, I would like to cite several relevant court cases, including SEC v. Trump, 279 F. Supp. 2d 340 (S.D.N.Y. 2003), SEC v. Trump, 2020 WL 4044162 (S.D.N.Y. July 17, 2020), and SEC v. Trump, 2021 WL 1520177 (S.D.N.Y. April 19, 2021). These cases demonstrate the importance of transparency and accountability in the securities industry, and underscore the need for disclosure of relevant complaints and information.

Additionally, I would like to provide notice that any withholding or deletion of responsive records without a lawful basis will result in my pursuit of legal action and complaint to the appropriate authorities. As you are aware, FOIA requires agencies to disclose all non-exempt records in response to a request within a reasonable time frame, and any failure to do so would constitute a violation of the law.

Please provide any responsive records to this request on a rolling basis, as they become available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen
